profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 17:55:31 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Artists' files and research notes, arranged by artist and movement, notably files on Georges Braque and a Braque exhibition, 1954; notes on Braque and Paul Cezanne from a lecture by William Rubin; photographs of work by Juan Gris, and photographs of the Gallery of Modern Art Including the Huntington Hartford Collection; correspondence concerning Potter's job search, Huntington Hartford Gallery, and letters from Douglas Cooper, 1970-1983, with whom Potter worked on a catalogue raisonne of Juan Gris, and with a friend of Cooper after Cooper's death; and printed material including clippings relating to the Huntington Hartford Gallery, and an extensive postcard collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Art historian and curator at Museum of Modern Art and Huntington Hartford Gallery of Modern Art; New York, N.Y. Died 1992.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Margaret Potter's sister, Barbara Troyer, 1992.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Margaret Potter Papers, 1896-1974, are located at The Museum of Modern Art Archives.

controlaccess.corpname: Gallery of Modern Art Including the Huntington Hartford Collection
